description:
Change of use from office use (class B1) to residential use
(Class C3) together with a rear extension ground floor to
form 8 self contained residential units,
as shown on drawing numbers 0024/4 B; 0024/5 B; 0024/6 D;
and 0024/7 C.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development shall be constructed in strict accordance with the drawings hereby approved or drawings which are subsequently approved pursuant to conditions which are attached to this planning permission.

Condition : 2 - Prior to the commencement of work on site, a scheme
    providing for the insulation of the proposed dwellings
    against the transmission of externally generated traffic
    noise (and vibration) from Acton Street and the adjacent
    London Underground railway line shall be submitted to and
    approved by the Council. Any works which form part of the
    scheme shall be completed in accordance with the approved
    details before the dwellings are occupied.

Condition : 3 - Before the development commences, samples of the proposed
    fenestration within the side (eastern) elevation shall be
    submitted to and approved by the Council. Such windows shall
    be acoustic double glazed.

Condition : 4 - Windows within the western elevation at first floor level
    shall remain obscured glazed and fixed shut at all times,
    excluding a small top opening panel which shall also be
    obscure glazed.

Condition : 5 - Prior to occupation of development, details relating to the
    specification of the proposed internal refuse store shall be
    submitted to and approved by the Council. Such matters shall
    include details relating to ventilation and the mechanical
    lift.

Condition : 6 - All new external work shall be carried out in materials that resemble, as closely as possible, in colour and texture those of the existing building, unless otherwise specified in the approved application.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 7 - The details of the [layout, sections, elevations and facing materials] to be used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. [Such details shall include proposed slab levels of the building in relation to the existing and proposed levels of the site and the surrounding land.] These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 8 - Notwithstanding the approved drawings, no development shall
    commence until details and drawings at a scale of 1:50 of
    the front elevation to Acton Street, have been submitted to
    and approved by the Council.

Condition : 9 - To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the
    character of the immediate area in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN31 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 10 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 11 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 12 - To safeguard the amenities of the proposed and adjacent
    residential premises and the area generally in  accordance
    with the requirements of policy RE2, and EN19 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 13 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN31 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 15 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN31 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 16 - To ensure that the external appearance of the building will
    be satisfactory in accordance with the requirements of
    policies EN1, EN31 and EN38 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 17 - The applicant should be aware that additional condition 8
    requires a revised design for the front elevation to be
    submitted to the Council for approval. This revised drawing
    should provide a more appropriate treatment in terms of
    window size and position. The applicants are advised to
    contact the Council for further information if required.

Condition : 18 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 19 - The details required pursuant to additional condition 2, 3,
    5, 7 and 8 should be submitted with the attached approval of
    details application form together with 5 sets of drawings
    and any other supporting information.
